rules: Rule1: Provided that the sensor network detects a habitat encroachment event, the wildlife agency issues an alert to the public.
Rule2: The sensor network detects a habitat encroachment event or the community group receives a report of habitat encroachment.

Rule3: Whenever the community group receives a report of habitat encroachment, then if it is not the case that the wildlife agency observing a decline in the red squirrel implies it lists the red squirrel as endangered, the wildlife agency triggers an emergency protocol.
Rule4: Under the condition that the funding board approves a grant for green bonds, Parliament enacts the habitat protection bill into law.
Rule5: The funding board approves a grant for green bonds or the funding board approves a grant for conservation tax credits.

Rule6: In case the parliament committee holds a hearing on the habitat protection bill, then if it is not true that the funding board approving a grant for conservation tax credits implies Parliament enacts the bill into law, Parliament does not delay the vote on the habitat protection bill.
Rule7: Assuming the environment ministry requests a hearing on the habitat protection bill, the parliament committee holds a hearing on the bill.
Rule8: Either the environment ministry requests a hearing on the habitat protection bill, or the conservation NGO requests a hearing on it.
Rule9: If the environment ministry introduces the habitat protection bill, then it amends the bill with a funding clause.
Rule10: On the condition that the conservation NGO requests a hearing on the habitat protection bill, the parliament committee holds a hearing on the bill.

Rule11: Whenever the environment ministry drafts a proposal for the habitat protection bill, then if it introduces the bill, the failure of Parliament to enact the bill into law implies the city council does not pass legislation concerning it.
Rule12: Whenever the wildlife agency submits a report containing population data, the university submits a report containing population data.

Rule13: Provided that the university submits a report containing population data, then in the event the environment ministry does not draft a proposal for the habitat protection bill, the conservation NGO drafts a proposal for it.

Rule14: If the environment ministry consults stakeholders from local businesses, then if it amends the habitat protection bill with an enforcement clause, Parliament’s failure to enact the bill into law results in the city council not passing legislation concerning it.
Rule15: The environment ministry consults stakeholders from local businesses or it consults stakeholders from the residents association.
Rule16: If Parliament postpones the habitat protection bill, then it does not fast-track the habitat protection bill.
Rule17: Provided that the environment ministry amends the habitat protection bill with a funding clause, it amends the bill with an enforcement clause.
Rule18: Under the condition that the property developer challenges the legality of the habitat protection bill, it files a lawsuit against the bill.
Rule19: Should the property developer file a lawsuit against the habitat protection bill, the city council does not pass legislation concerning it.

Rule20: If the regulatory body monitors compliance with the habitat protection bill, then in the event it is not the case that the wildlife agency observing a decline in the red squirrel implies it lists the red squirrel as endangered, the regulatory body initiates a review of conservation policy.
Rule21: Provided that the regulatory body audits compliance with the habitat protection bill, it monitors compliance with the bill.
Rule22: Either the parliament committee schedules a hearing on the habitat protection bill, or if it does not hold a hearing on the bill, it cancels the hearing on the bill.
Rule23: Assuming the industry group opposes the habitat protection bill, it endorses the habitat protection bill.
Rule24: If the environment ministry amends the habitat protection bill with an enforcement clause, the legal office reviews the bill.

Rule25: Given that the environment ministry amends the habitat protection bill with a monitoring clause, then Parliament’s failure to enact the bill into law implies the city council does not pass legislation concerning it.

Rule26: In case the university conducts a study on the urban fox population, then if the legal office reviews the habitat protection bill, the environment ministry amends the bill with a monitoring clause.
Rule27: Under the condition that the city treasury allocates funds to the conservation program, Parliament enacts the habitat protection bill into law.

Rule28: Should it not be the case that the funding board approving a grant for conservation tax credits implies Parliament enacts the bill into law, Parliament delays the vote on the habitat protection bill.

Rule29: If it is not the case that the wildlife agency observing a decline in the red squirrel implies it lists the red squirrel as endangered, the regulatory body does not initiate a review of conservation policy.

Rule30: Whenever it is not the case that the failure of the funding board approving a grant for conservation tax credits to imply Parliament enacts the bill leads to Parliament not delaying the vote, the industry group opposes the habitat protection bill.

Rule31: Provided that it is not the case that the failure of the funding board approving a grant for conservation tax credits to imply Parliament enacts the bill entails Parliament not delaying the vote, the industry group does not endorse the habitat protection bill.

Rule32: Should it not be true that the failure of the environment ministry consulting stakeholders from the residents association to imply that, if it amends the bill with an enforcement clause, Parliament’s failure to enact the bill leads to the city council not passing legislation, results in the city council rejecting the bill, then Parliament fast-tracks the habitat protection bill.

Rule33: If it is not the case that the failure of the environment ministry consulting stakeholders from the residents association to imply that, if it amends the bill with an enforcement clause, Parliament’s failure to enact the bill leads to the city council not passing legislation, entails the city council rejecting the bill, then Parliament postpones the habitat protection bill.
Rule34: Assuming the parliament committee does not hold a hearing on the habitat protection bill, it does not cancel the hearing on the bill.
Rule35: If the environment ministry does not draft a proposal for the habitat protection bill, the conservation NGO does not draft a proposal for it.
Rule36: Whenever the city treasury does not allocate funds to the conservation program, the wildlife agency observes a decline in the red squirrel.
Rule37: Should Parliament not enact the habitat protection bill into law, the city council passes legislation concerning the habitat protection bill.
Rule38: Under the condition that Parliament does not enact the habitat protection bill into law, the property developer challenges the legality of the bill.
facts: Fact1: The environment ministry introduces the habitat protection bill.
Fact2: The wildlife agency submits a report containing population data.
Fact3: The regulatory body audits compliance with the habitat protection bill.
Fact4: The university conducts a study on the urban fox population.
Fact5: It is not the case that the wildlife agency lists the red squirrel as endangered.
Fact6: The wildlife agency does not trigger an emergency protocol.
Fact7: The wildlife agency does not issue an alert to the public.
Fact8: The city council does not reject the habitat protection bill.
Fact9: The parliament committee does not schedule a hearing on the habitat protection bill.

question: Parliament enacts the habitat protection bill into law.
